document.heading: Food Regulation Temporary Amendment Act of 2001

history.narrative: Law 14-55, the “Food Regulation Temporary Amendment Act of 2001”, was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 14-300, which was retained by Council. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on July 10, 2001, and September 19, 2001, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on October 2, 2001, it was assigned Act No. 14-135 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 14-55 became effective on December 6, 2001.
